\begin{abstract}
The scaled factorial moments $F_q$ are studied for a second-order
quark-hadron phase transition within the Ginzburg-Landau description.
The role played by the ground state of the system under low temperature
is emphasized. After a local shift of the order parameter the fluctuations
are around the ground state, and a perturbative calculation for $F_q$
can be carried out. Power scaling between $F_q$'s is shown, and a universal
scaling exponent $\nu\simeq 1.75$ is given for the case with weak
correlations and weak self-interactions.
